content:
The standard describes requirements, specifications and test-methods for clocks, watches and their components.

|   Section | Changes                                                                        |
|----------:|:-------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|     nan   | Updated standard format and wording.                                           |
|       1   | Battery requirements differentiated for wall hanging and free standing clocks. |
|       2.1 | Approved clock movements (Table 3) updated.                                    |

Page 1/4

Edition 2 – 2022-04 Compliancequality@JYSK.com

Clocks must comply with Table 1.

Clocks must be battery driven. Pi cannty Rationale: Clocks supplied by mains electricity require extensive testing to show compliance with the Low Voltage Pply Directive (LVD). Testing would as a minimum include the harmonized standards EN 60335-1 and EN 60335-2-26.

e Must not be included with the product. e The type and amount of battery must be stated on the packaging. Use of ‘alkaline’ batteries must be advised in the supplied instructions.

Change The product must be designed to allow easy change of batteries of Construction i . batteries | requirements

The battery compartment must be directly accessible or accessible without use of tools. Free standing clocks | The battery compartment design must comply with JYSK 4005. Products using the radio frequency spectrum are not permitted. Rationale: Products that use the radio frequency spectrum require extensive testing to show compliance with the Radio Equipment Directive (RED). Loudness must be specified in the format [dB(A) @ 10 cm] Permitted range: 60-90 Tolerance: Less than +3

Wall hanging clocks must include a ‘keyhole’ or similar shaped recess for hanging. ging

wall ti mounting The internal recess edge must be <4 mm from the plane that contacts with the wall.

Sharp edges p eag

Accessible sharp edges are not permitted. Terminals

in the battery compartment are omitted regarded they do not pose a safety risk. Nominal Minimum

(When included)

Page 2/4

Analog clocks must comply with Table 2.

Page 4/4
Edition 2 – 2022-04 Compliancequality@JYSK.com
The standard describes requirements, specifications and test-methods for clocks, watches and their components.

Section Changes Updated standard format and wording. All Updated tables and references. Old chapter 2.3 regarding watches removed. Old chapter 3/3.1 merged with 2.1. 1 Battery requirements differentiated for wall hanging and free standing clocks. 2.1 Approved clock movements (Table 3) updated.
Edition 2 – 2022-04 Compliancequality@JYSK.com
Clocks must comply with Table 1.

Clocks must be battery driven. Pi cannty Rationale: Clocks supplied by mains electricity require extensive testing to show compliance with the Low Voltage Pply Directive (LVD). Testing would as a minimum include the harmonized standards EN 60335-1 and EN 60335-2-26.
e Must not be included with the product. e The type and amount of battery must be stated on the packaging. Use of ‘alkaline’ batteries must be advised in the supplied instructions.
Change The product must be designed to allow easy change of batteries of Construction i . batteries | requirements

The battery compartment must be directly accessible or accessible without use of tools. Free standing clocks | The battery compartment design must comply with JYSK 4005. Products using the radio frequency spectrum are not permitted. Rationale: Products that use the radio frequency spectrum require extensive testing to show compliance with the Radio Equipment Directive (RED). Loudness must be specified in the format [dB(A) @ 10 cm] Permitted range: 60-90 Tolerance: Less than +3
Wall hanging clocks must include a ‘keyhole’ or similar shaped recess for hanging. ging
wall ti mounting The internal recess edge must be <4 mm from the plane that contacts with the wall.
Sharp edges p eag
Accessible sharp edges are not permitted. Terminals in the battery compartment are omitted regarded they do not pose a safety risk. Nominal Minimum
Table 1 – Requirements for clocks
Edition 2 – 2022-04 Compliancequality@JYSK.com
Analog clocks must comply with Table 2.

Examples Crystal oscillator 32,768 kHz Battery type for clock movement 1 x 1,5 V AA battery Operation voltage 1,3 ~ 1,7 V Operation temperature -10°C ~ 50°C Current consumption ≤200 μA at 1,5V DC Must be sweep and not noisy. Only approved movements according to Table 3 must be used - Use of other movements must be approved by JYSK C&Q. The following is as a minimum required for the approval process of other movements: Clock movements • Three physical samples • Brand and model designation • Specifications from the movement manufacturer: • Accuracy • Current consumption • Hand allowance Time keeping accuracy according to ISO 19235 or GB/T 6046-2016 Instantaneous rate (𝑚̅) Voltage coefficient (Cu) or (Cv) Temperature coefficient (Ct) ±1,0 [s/d] ±1,5 [s/(d∙V)] 𝐶𝑡1: 0 ~ 0,12 [s/(d∙°C)] 𝐶𝑡2: 0 ~ -0,12 [s/(d∙°C)] Hands • Hour- • Minute- • Length • Weight • Unbalance Must be within the allowance specified by clock-movement manufacturer. • Second- • Material Plastic or metal Table 2 – Requirements for analog clocks

Brand Model* Producer Heng-Rong • HR1688SS Dongguan Heng-Rong Hardware Electronic Technology Co., Ltd. JH • S001 Dongguan Jiahao Clock Manufacturing Co., Ltd. JinHong • JH-8188S Zhangzhou Jinhong Electronic Co., Ltd. Fujian Virtue Industry Co., Ltd. Long Deli • 8188S or Tong yuan electronic Co., Ltd • KS302 POWER • KSA302 Shenzhen Golden Power Precision Electronics Co., Ltd. • KSC302 Sang tai • 7168S Zhangzhou Sangtai Timepiece Co., Ltd. YOUNG TOWN • 12888ST Dongguan Young Town Co., Ltd. ZHONGHUI • Q6 Longhai Zhonghui Watch Co. Ltd. *Note: Most models exist in several versions with different shafts.
Table 3 – Approved clock movements
Edition 2 – 2022-04 Compliancequality@JYSK.com
Digital clocks must comply with Table 4.

Time keeping accuracy according to ISO 19235 or GB/T 6046-2016
